article.headline: Marist 69, St. Peter's 61
article.story: JERSEY CITY, N.J. (AP) -- Ryan Schneider came off the bench to score 17 points -- one of five Marist players in double figures -- as the Red Foxes beat St. Peter's 69-61 on Sunday. Ben Farmer added 13 points and David Devezin finished with 11 points and eight assists for Marist (15-10, 9-5 in Metro Atlantic Athletic Conference), which snapped a three-game losing streak. Spongy Benjamin and Ryan Stilphen both had 10 points, while Benjamin also pulled down eight rebounds. Todd Sowell had 15 points, 11 rebounds and five assists for the Peacocks (5-19, 2-12), while Nick Leon added 14 points. St. Peter's was in command early on and lead 34-25 at the break. However, the Red Foxes opened the second half with a 12-2 run and then took the lead for good when Benjamin made two free throws with 16:35 left to play. The Peacocks fought back and eventually cut the lead to 57-55 when Darrell Lampley made two free throws with 3:47 remaining. They would not get any closer, though, as Marist closed the game with a 12-6 run.

statistics.description: The number of points scored.

statistics.description: Free Throw makes and attempts.

statistics.name: assists
statistics.description: The number of times a player who passes the ball to a teammate in a way that leads to a score by field goal, meaning that he or she was "assisting" in the basket. There is some judgment involved in deciding whether a passer should be credited with an assist.

statistics.name: turnovers
statistics.description: The number of times a player loses possession to the other team.

statistics.description: The total number of minutes played.

statistics.name: assistTurnoverRatio
statistics.description: The average number of assists a player or team records per turnover
